SeProxyService - Class in org.keyple.seproxy
The Class SeProxyService.
SeRequest - Class in org.keyple.seproxy
Aggregates the elements of a request to a local or remote SE Reader, sent through a ProxyReader, in order to open a logical channel with a SE application to select, and to transfer a group of APDU commands to run.
SeRequest(ByteBuffer, List<ApduRequest>, boolean) - Constructor for class org.keyple.seproxy.SeRequest
Deprecated.
Only provided as a compatibility layer. You should now use SeRequest.SeRequest(List) constructor with a list of SeRequestElements.

Constructor
SeRequestElement - Class in org.keyple.seproxy
List of APDU requests that will result in a SeResponseElement
SeRequestElement(ByteBuffer, List<ApduRequest>, boolean) - Constructor for class org.keyple.seproxy.SeRequestElement
the constructor called by a ProxyReader in order to open a logical channel, to send a set of APDU commands to a SE application, or both of them.
SeRequestElement(List<ApduRequest>) - Constructor for class org.keyple.seproxy.SeRequestElement
 
SeResponse - Class in org.keyple.seproxy
Aggregates the elements of a response from a local or remote SE Reader, received through a ProxyReader, including a group of APDU responses and the previous status of the logical channel with the targeted SE application.
SeResponse(boolean, ApduResponse, List<ApduResponse>) - Constructor for class org.keyple.seproxy.SeResponse
Deprecated.
You should use SeResponse.SeResponse(List) with SeResponseElement.SeResponseElement(boolean, ApduResponse, List)

transmit(SeRequest) - Method in interface org.keyple.seproxy.ProxyReader
Transmits a request to a SE application and get back the corresponding SE response o the usage of this method is conditioned to the presence of a SE in the selected reader, this method could also fail in case of IO error or wrong card state some readers exceptions (SE missing, IO error, wrong card state, timeout) have to be caught during the processing of the SE request transmission.
